job_description:
Overview:

Patra is a leading provider of Technology-Enabled Services to the insurance industry. Patra’s team of global experts allow brokers, MGAs, wholesalers, and carriers to capture the Patra Advantage – profitable growth and organizational value.

Patra powers insurance processes by optimizing the application of people and technology; supporting insurance organizations as they sell, deliver, and manage policies for their customers.

The Patra sales team is organized into two divisions, Retail and Specialty. The Retail team works with retail insurance brokers/agencies and the Specialty team works with MGA's, Wholesalers, Insurance Carriers, and Insurtech's. The VP of Business Development, Specialty role is within the Specialty sales team.

About this job

The VP of Business Development role is highly process-oriented and well connected in selling services and technology, or BPO to the insurance brokerage industry along with BPO experience. Role will work in results versus quota driven environment, focused on the large and very large insurance broker segment. Candidate will possess knowledge and understanding of business dynamics, vernacular used by MGA's, Wholesalers, and Insurance Carriers, and will have a record of exceptional sales achievement. The ability to undergo a detailed discovery process into the pain points and workflows of our client's business will be essential. A strategic mindset that understands buying personas and the decision-making criteria of our customers will be critical. Individuals will need to be a motivated self-starter with strong communication skills and must have the ability to present to a variety of audiences, and work in a decentralized organization.

Responsibilities:

Core Requirements by Competency:

Modern Sales Acuity and Strategic Thinker
• Prior experience with the development, documentation, and execution of strategic Account Plans
• Strong relationship-building and relationship-management skills
• Deal planning and revenue forecasting - frequency and accuracy
• Understanding of modern sales methodologies such as MEDDPICC
• Enterprise sales experience and clear strategic thinking ability
• Defend pricing structure and value in a competitive marketplace where competition could be third party, internal, and/or multiple decision-makers
• Experience in contracts and SOWs

Insurance Industry Experience
• Enterprise insurance experience and understanding of MGA, Wholesale, and Carrier sectors including the challenges they face engaging with their trading partners
• Discuss, present, and fully understand services and technology offered to enterprise clients/prospects
• Ability to identify opportunities for growth - that align with Patra Services
• Stays abreast and maintain detailed knowledge of current market conditions and technical knowledge in the insurance industry and MGA, Wholesale, and Carrier segments

Accountable
• A command and use of a CRM for Account and Deal visibility and forecasting
• Closure of New Logo's and Cross Selling (land and expand)
• Identify, develop, and structure enterprise proposals as well as enterprise contracts and statements of work (SOWs)
• Engage subject matter experts and include them in discussions with clients/prospects throughout the sales process

Team Player
• Actively participate in sales meetings, sales cycles, understand the stages and pipeline, and basic metrics
• Coordination & Communication with Operations, Legal, and Executive functions to ensure overall continuity and coordination
• Establish and maintain strong and positive relationships with the sales team and throughout the organization as well as with the C-suite clients/prospects
• Interpersonal Skills:
• Demonstrates the ability to work well with Patra colleagues and clients and with external organizations
• Promotes Culture of Respect & Safety:
• Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety and respect
• Communicates concerns
• Uses and promotes safe respectful behaviors based on training and lessons learned

Qualifications:

Minimum Requirements - Education and Experience
• 5 to 10+ years minimum of Sales Experience in the Insurance sector, preferably Wholesale/MGA/Carrier Vertical
• Prior B2B Sales Experience with a consistent track record of success
• BPO Experience preferred but not required
• Bachelor’s degree

Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
• Ability to travel to customer sites and industry events
• High integrity and ability to establish trust
• Strong negotiation skills and excellent use of business judgment
• Excellent listening, verbal, and written communication skills
• Good computer, internet skills, and Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint
• Professional approach and demeanor

Working Conditions
• Frequent travel by all forms of transportation including: flying, driving, car services, trains, buses
• Occasionally stand/walk, writing by hand, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh 11-20 pounds
• Sort/file paperwork, rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat
• Consistent with its obligations under the law, the Patra Corp will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.

Working Conditions
• Work from home - Ability to work in a decentralized organization
• Travel within the Eastern United States and occasionally outside that geographical area
• Minimum internet speed of 6 mbps download and 3 mbps upload; no satellite

Compensation
• Competitive Salary / Benefits / PTO

Physical Requirements*
• Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks
• Frequent sitting
• Occasionally stand/walk, writing by hand, use of telephone, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh 11-20 pounds
• Sort/file paperwork, rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat
• Consistent with its obligations under the law, the Patra Corp will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.
• Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable Patra Corp policies and procedures

Patra Corporation is an equal opportunity employer committed to celebrating diversity and creating a safe and inclusive environment for all employees.
